scenes.script:
Hello bright minds! Today we're going to delve into the practical and powerful tools within React and the Axios library to enhance your web development skills. React allows you to build dynamic web applications with ease, and when combined with Axios, a popular library for making HTTP requests, you get a supercharged development experience.

We will start by looking at React forms which are essential for capturing user inputs efficiently. Then, we'll learn how to display lists of data smoothly with React's unique key props system that optimizes rendering and ensures your app runs fast and smooth. Afterward, we will introduce Axios for making network requests to fetch, post, or manipulate data on servers.

By utilizing a simple yet powerful tool like JSON Server, we will simulate a real backend for our exercises, giving you a near-real experience of working with APIs. After our session, you'll be equipped to create more interactive and responsive web applications that feel seamless to users. Let's get started and unlock these new skills together!
scenes.slide:
React Forms, Lists, Keys & Axios Library

  • React Forms:
    • Capturing user inputs made simple
  • Lists and Keys:
    • Rendering lists with optimized performance
  • Axios & JSON Server:
    • Making network requests to a simulated backend

scenes.slide:
Understanding React's Keys

Why are keys important in a React list?

  1. a) They help React identify which items have changed, are added, or are removed.
  2. b) They are used to improve the design and style of the list.
  3. c) They represent the network status of list items.
  4. d) They secure the data transmission between the client and the server.

answer: a) They help React identify which items have changed, are added, or are removed.
options: a) They help React identify which items have changed, are added, or are removed.
b) They are used to improve the design and style of the list.
c) They represent the network status of list items.
d) They secure the data transmission between the client and the server.
